acronyms.name: Authentication, Authorization, Accounting
acronyms.description: Framework for controlling access to resources, verifying identity, and tracking user activities

acronyms.name: Attribute-Based Access Control
acronyms.description: Access control model that uses attributes (user, resource, environment) to make access decisions

acronyms.name: Access Control List
acronyms.description: List of permissions attached to an object specifying which users or systems can access it

acronyms.name: Advanced Encryption Standard
acronyms.description: Symmetric encryption algorithm widely used for securing data, supporting 128, 192, and 256-bit keys

acronyms.name: Annualized Loss Expectancy
acronyms.description: Expected monetary loss per year from a risk, calculated as SLE Ã— ARO

acronyms.name: Triple Data Encryption Standard
acronyms.description: Legacy symmetric encryption algorithm that applies DES three times, now considered deprecated

acronyms.name: Application Programming Interface
acronyms.description: Set of protocols and tools for building software applications and enabling communication between systems

acronyms.name: Advanced Persistent Threat
acronyms.description: Sophisticated, long-term cyberattack where attackers maintain unauthorized access to a network

acronyms.name: Annualized Rate of Occurrence
acronyms.description: Expected number of times a threat will occur within a year, used in risk calculations

acronyms.name: Adversarial Tactics, Techniques, and Common Knowledge
acronyms.description: MITRE framework documenting adversary tactics and techniques for cybersecurity threat modeling

acronyms.name: Acceptable Use Policy
acronyms.description: Policy defining acceptable ways users can use organizational systems and resources

acronyms.name: Asset Value
acronyms.description: Monetary value assigned to an asset, used in risk assessment calculations

acronyms.name: Business Continuity Plan
acronyms.description: Document outlining procedures to maintain business operations during and after a disaster

acronyms.name: Business Email Compromise
acronyms.description: Social engineering attack targeting businesses to fraudulently transfer funds or sensitive data

acronyms.name: Business Impact Analysis
acronyms.description: Process identifying critical business functions and assessing impact of disruptions

acronyms.name: Robot
acronyms.description: Automated software program that performs tasks over the internet, can be malicious or benign

acronyms.name: Command and Control
acronyms.description: Infrastructure used by attackers to communicate with and control compromised systems

acronyms.name: Certificate Authority
acronyms.description: Trusted entity that issues and manages digital certificates for PKI

acronyms.name: Cloud Access Security Broker
acronyms.description: Security tool that sits between cloud service users and providers to enforce security policies

acronyms.name: Closed-Circuit Television
acronyms.description: Video surveillance system for physical security monitoring

acronyms.name: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment
acronyms.description: DevOps practices for automating software build, test, and deployment processes

acronyms.name: Certificate Revocation List
acronyms.description: List of revoked digital certificates that are no longer trusted

acronyms.name: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing
acronyms.description: Browser security mechanism allowing web pages to request resources from different domains

acronyms.name: Cloud Service Provider
acronyms.description: Company offering cloud computing services (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)

acronyms.name: Certificate Signing Request
acronyms.description: Message sent to a CA to request a digital certificate

acronyms.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery
acronyms.description: Attack forcing authenticated users to execute unwanted actions on a web application

acronyms.name: Common Vulnerability Scoring System
acronyms.description: Standardized framework for rating severity of security vulnerabilities

acronyms.name: Discretionary Access Control
acronyms.description: Access control model where resource owners determine access permissions

acronyms.name: Dynamic Application Security Testing
acronyms.description: Security testing method that analyzes running applications for vulnerabilities

acronyms.name: Data Encryption Standard
acronyms.description: Legacy symmetric encryption algorithm with 56-bit keys, now considered insecure

acronyms.name: Distributed Denial of Service
acronyms.description: Attack using multiple compromised systems to overwhelm a target with traffic

acronyms.name: Diffie-Hellman
acronyms.description: Key exchange algorithm allowing two parties to establish a shared secret over insecure channels

acronyms.name: Data Loss Prevention
acronyms.description: Security technology preventing unauthorized access, use, or transmission of sensitive data

acronyms.name: Demilitarized Zone
acronyms.description: Network segment between internal and external networks hosting public-facing services

acronyms.name: Denial of Service
acronyms.description: Attack preventing legitimate users from accessing a system or service

acronyms.name: Damage, Reproducibility, Exploitability, Affected Users, Discoverability
acronyms.description: Risk assessment model for evaluating security threats using five categories

acronyms.name: Disaster Recovery Plan
acronyms.description: Documented procedures for recovering IT systems and data after a disaster

acronyms.name: Digital Signature Algorithm
acronyms.description: Cryptographic algorithm used for creating and verifying digital signatures

acronyms.name: Elliptic Curve Cryptography
acronyms.description: Public key cryptography using elliptic curves, providing strong security with smaller key sizes

acronyms.name: Endpoint Detection and Response
acronyms.description: Security solution monitoring endpoints for threats and providing automated response capabilities

acronyms.name: Exposure Factor
acronyms.description: Percentage of asset value lost if a threat occurs, used in risk calculations

acronyms.name: End of Life
acronyms.description: Point when a product is no longer supported or maintained by the vendor

acronyms.name: Elevation of Privilege
acronyms.description: Attack technique where an attacker gains higher-level privileges than intended

acronyms.name: Full Disk Encryption
acronyms.description: Encryption of entire storage device to protect data at rest

acronyms.name: Fast Identity Online
acronyms.description: Authentication standards for passwordless and multi-factor authentication

acronyms.name: File Integrity Monitoring
acronyms.description: Security process monitoring files for unauthorized changes or modifications

acronyms.name: General Data Protection Regulation
acronyms.description: EU regulation protecting personal data and privacy of EU citizens

acronyms.name: Governance, Risk, and Compliance
acronyms.description: Framework for managing organizational governance, risk management, and regulatory compliance

acronyms.name: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
acronyms.description: US law protecting health information privacy and security

acronyms.name: Host-Based Intrusion Detection System
acronyms.description: Security tool monitoring individual hosts for suspicious activities

acronyms.name: Host-Based Intrusion Prevention System
acronyms.description: Security tool that detects and prevents intrusions on individual hosts

acronyms.name: Hash-Based Message Authentication Code
acronyms.description: Cryptographic authentication code using a hash function and secret key

acronyms.name: HMAC-Based One-Time Password
acronyms.description: One-time password algorithm using HMAC for authentication

acronyms.name: Hardware Security Module
acronyms.description: Physical device managing and protecting cryptographic keys

acronyms.name: Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning
acronyms.description: Environmental control system important for data center physical security

acronyms.name: Identity and Access Management
acronyms.description: Framework for managing user identities and controlling access to resources

acronyms.name: Interactive Application Security Testing
acronyms.description: Security testing method combining SAST and DAST approaches

acronyms.name: Infrastructure as a Service
acronyms.description: Cloud computing model providing virtualized computing resources over the internet

acronyms.name: Identity Provider
acronyms.description: Service that authenticates users and provides identity information to other applications

acronyms.name: Intrusion Detection System
acronyms.description: Security tool monitoring network or systems for malicious activities

acronyms.name: Indicator of Compromise
acronyms.description: Artifact observed on a system indicating a potential security breach

acronyms.name: Intrusion Prevention System
acronyms.description: Security tool that detects and actively blocks malicious activities

acronyms.name: Incident Response
acronyms.description: Process for handling security incidents and breaches

acronyms.name: Incident Response Plan
acronyms.description: Documented procedures for responding to security incidents

acronyms.name: Infrastructure as Code
acronyms.description: Managing and provisioning infrastructure through machine-readable definition files

acronyms.name: Key Performance Indicator
acronyms.description: Measurable value demonstrating effectiveness of achieving key objectives

acronyms.name: Key Risk Indicator
acronyms.description: Metric used to provide early warning of increasing risk exposure

acronyms.name: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol
acronyms.description: Protocol for accessing and managing directory information services

acronyms.name: Living Off the Land Binaries
acronyms.description: Legitimate system tools and binaries used by attackers to avoid detection

acronyms.name: Mandatory Access Control
acronyms.description: Access control model where access decisions are made by the system, not users

acronyms.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
acronyms.description: Authentication requiring multiple verification factors (something you know, have, or are)

acronyms.description: Attack where attacker intercepts and potentially alters communication between two parties

acronyms.name: MITRE Corporation
acronyms.description: Nonprofit organization that maintains cybersecurity frameworks like ATT&CK

acronyms.name: Memorandum of Understanding
acronyms.description: Agreement between parties outlining mutual goals and responsibilities

acronyms.name: Master Service Agreement
acronyms.description: Contract establishing terms for future service agreements between parties

acronyms.name: Mean Time Between Failures
acronyms.description: Average time between system failures, used in reliability calculations

acronyms.name: Maximum Tolerable Downtime
acronyms.description: Maximum acceptable time a system can be unavailable before causing significant impact

acronyms.name: Mean Time to Repair or Respond

acronyms.name: Network Access Control
acronyms.description: Security approach controlling access to network resources based on device compliance

acronyms.name: Next-Generation Firewall
acronyms.description: Advanced firewall with application awareness and integrated intrusion prevention

acronyms.name: National Institute of Standards and Technology
acronyms.description: US agency developing cybersecurity frameworks and standards

acronyms.name: Network Time Protocol
acronyms.description: Protocol for synchronizing clocks across computer networks

acronyms.description: Protocol for checking revocation status of digital certificates in real-time

acronyms.name: One-Time Password
acronyms.description: Password valid for only one login session or transaction

acronyms.name: Open Worldwide Application Security Project
acronyms.description: Nonprofit organization focused on improving software security

acronyms.name: Privileged Access Management
acronyms.description: Security solution managing and monitoring privileged account access

acronyms.description: Cloud computing model providing platform for developing and deploying applications

acronyms.name: Protected Health Information
acronyms.description: Health information that can identify an individual, protected under HIPAA

acronyms.name: Personally Identifiable Information

acronyms.description: Process for planning, creating, testing, and deploying software

acronyms.description: Network architecture separating control plane from data plane for centralized management

acronyms.description: Security tool aggregating and analyzing logs from multiple sources
